entries.title: In Central Florida, Bolsonaro supporters explain their adoration of the former president
entries.description: Supporters of former Brazil president Jair Bolsonaro hoped for a chance encounter in Central Florida  where he's been staying and also hospitalized.

entries.title: Peru is in mourning over violent protests' growing death toll
entries.description: A three-day mourning period began in southern Peru after more were killed in the most violent day of protests since the ouster of former president Pedro Castillo.

entries.title: Ukrainian troops to be trained on Patriot air defense systems in the U.S., officials say
entries.description: The U.S. is planning to begin training Ukrainian troops on the Patriot air defense system in Oklahoma later this month, according to three defense officials.

entries.title: U.S. Navy seizes more than 2,000 AK-47s likely bound for Iranian-backed rebels in Yemen
entries.description: The U.S. Navy seized more than smuggled 2,000 assault rifles from a fishing boat on Friday that were likely bound for Iranian-backed rebels in Yemen.

entries.title: Prince Harry’s ‘Spare,’ detailing tensions among British royal family, hits bookshelves
entries.description: Prince Harry’s highly anticipated tell-all memoir “Spare” has hit bookshelves across the country and has already taken the number one spot on Amazon and Audible. NBC News’ Keir Simmons breaks down some of the bombshell allegations Prince Harry makes against the royal family.

entries.title: Photos: Riot in the heart of Brazil's government
entries.description: One plaza is home to Brazil’s three branches of government. On Sunday, far-right protesters descended.

entries.title: U.N. says Iran has 'weaponized' death penalty to strike fear
entries.description: Ravina Shamdasani, spokeswoman for the U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights, said that the death penalty was being weaponized by Iran's government to strike fear into the population.

entries.title: Newly restored house in Pompeii offers glimpse of elite life
entries.description: On Tuesday, the House of Vettii, Domus Vettiorum in Latin, was being formally unveiled after 20 years of restoration.

entries.title: Russia nears the capture of a town at the heart of 'savage' fighting in eastern Ukraine
entries.description: Russian forces appear close to capturing Soledar, a small but strategically important town on the front lines of the war near Bakhmut in eastern Ukraine.

entries.title: Brazilian authorities detain 1,500 people after attack on government buildings
entries.description: Authorities in Brazil are investigating an attack on the country’s government buildings by supporters of former President Jair Bolsonaro, who had made claims of election fraud throughout last year’s presidential election. NBC News’ Guad Venegas explains how Brazilian President Lula is reacting to the attack and whether it could lead to Bolsonaro’s extradition from the U.S.

entries.title: Why first customers of Harry's memoir 'Spare' want to read it
entries.description: Customers at a London bookshop who were among the first to buy Prince Harry's autobiography "Spare" explained why they wanted to read it.

entries.title: Thousands march to demand the prosecution of Brazil rioters
entries.description: Thousands protested in Brazil demanding the prosecution of rioters who stormed government buildings in support of Jair Bolsonaro.

entries.title: First mission to launch satellites into orbit from Western Europe suffers 'anomaly'
entries.description: A mission to launch the first satellites into orbit from Western Europe ended in failure when it suffered an “anomaly,” Virgin Orbit said.

entries.title: Andrew Tate in Romanian court to appeal detention
entries.description: Andrew Tate was in Romania court Tuesday  to appeal against a judge’s decision to extend his arrest period to 30 days on charges of human trafficking and rape.

entries.title: Protesters demand punishment for Brazilian rioters
entries.description: Thousands of Brazilians took to the streets of major cities on Monday, demanding retribution against supporters of former President Jair Bolsonaro who stormed government institutions the previous day.

entries.title: Virgin Orbit reports ‘anomaly’ in satellite launch from U.K.
entries.description: A mission to launch the first satellites into orbit from Western Europe suffered an “anomaly” Tuesday, Virgin Orbit said.

entries.title: Parallels between Brazil, U.S. politics made attack predictable to many
entries.description: Months of Bolsonaro’s Trump-like rigged election claims left Brazilians in the U.S. predicting a ‘response’ they saw culminated in Brazil's recent riot.

entries.title: Prince Harry's memoir, 'Spare,' that captures the ugly sides of royal life hits bookshelves
entries.description: Prince Harry’s memoir was released Tuesday, not only offering new details on the British royal family’s bitter internal feud after days of bombshell

entries.title: Scientists say restoration of the ozone layer is back on track
entries.description: Scientist claim that the Earth’s ozone layer is improving due to a decline in the use of a banned chemical called chlorofluorocarbons, or CFCs, used as a refrigerant. NBC News Meteorologist Bill Karins has more on the latest findings.

entries.title: Prince Harry accuses Camilla of leaking negative stories in new interview
entries.description: Prince Harry is speaking out alongside his book release about royal life and the British media, even accusing his stepmother Camilla of leaking negative stories to journalists. NBC News’ Keir Simmons has more details on the family fallout.

entries.title: Around 1,500 Brazilians arrested after storming capital
entries.description: Around 1,500 Brazilians are behind bars for storming the capital. Those arrested supported former President Jair Bolsonaro who, like former President Trump, pushed a narrative of electoral fraud for months without evidence. NBC News’ Sam Brock has more details about the fallout.
